Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.Nobody in the class is as tall as Mike.F
answer: Everybody in the class is taller than Mike.
Somebody in the class may be shorter than Mike.
Mike is the tallest student in the class.

question: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.I haven't got enough money to buy a new car.
answer: I need more money to buy a new car.
I don't want to spend more money on a new car.
A new car is not something I really need.
Money is not the most essential issue to buy a new car.

question: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.I am really keen on playing sports.
answer: I am a big fan of sports.
I am not really into sports.

question: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.“I will come back home soon,” he said.
answer: He advised to come back home soon.
He offered to come back home soon.
He promised to come back home soon.
He suggested that he should come back home soon.

question: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.He prevented his close friend from telling the truth.
answer: He forbade his close friend to tell the truth.
He allowed his close friend to tell the truth.
He ordered his close friend to tell the truth.
He paid his close friend to tell the truth.
